Posts.Content: julijac wrote: I have had a lump under my right armpit for about 18 months now.  I told my doctor at the time I found it (10/2008) and I had a mammogram and sonogram on the lump.  They said it didn't show anything.  I didn't worry about it anymore since they didn't seem concerned.  Now, almost a year and a half later I still have the lump and it seems to be getting bigger.  I went to my new FP (just moved) to discuss what to do about it now, and he is concerned it could be cancer.  I am being scheduled for a sonogram.  I have a Facebook friend that advised me that a friend of hers had the same problem and her doctor's weren't worried about her lump, but she insisted on a biopsy and found that it was cancer.  She said that sonograms can have a false reading, and I should definitely do a biopsy.  Breast cancer runs in my family (mom and aunt), and all my mammograms have come back normal.  Two questions:  Should I worry?  Should I have a biopsy?  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Lump in armpit julijac AnacortesGirl
